meanings.definition: The end or finish of an event or process.
meanings.sent1: At the conclusion of the movie, everyone clapped.
meanings.sent2: The conclusion of the race was marked by a loud cheer.
meanings.sent3: The conclusion of the magic show left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The conclusion of the play was like the final piece of a puzzle falling into place.
meanings.sent5: The conclusion of the story was so satisfying that it stayed with me for days.

meanings.definition: A judgment or decision reached after considering evidence.
meanings.sent1: The detective came to a conclusion after examining the clues.
meanings.sent2: Her conclusion about the case was based on solid facts.
meanings.sent3: The conclusion that the cat was the culprit made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Reaching a conclusion in a complex case can be like solving a mystery.
meanings.sent5: His conclusion was so clear and logical that no one could argue against it.

meanings.definition: A final part of a text or speech that summarizes the main points.
meanings.sent1: In the conclusion of his speech, he reiterated his main ideas.
meanings.sent2: The conclusion of the book tied up all loose ends perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The conclusion of the presentation left the audience nodding in agreement.
meanings.sent4: The conclusion of the debate was a powerful reminder of the key arguments.
meanings.sent5: Her conclusion in the essay was so well-written that it left a lasting impression.
